page.title: 18WALKING AND CLIMBING
page.content: People travel great distances to come to Bodmin Moor because it is one of the few places left in the country where people can walk about in a natural environment which is not (yet) crowded with other people. The many tors on the moor offer opportunities for climbing. One of the attractions of climbing to the top of these tors is the wonderful views which can be seen on clear days. For example on the top of Brown Willy and Rough Tor it is possible to see the north and south coasts of Cornwall at the same time. In the 1950s a party of Buddhist monks from Thailand came to Brown Willy and held a religious ceremony because they thought it was such a good place.
